column4: How do I make a script run every time the machine is started up, and the network has come up?
cron would be the way but I don't know how to use cron. man cron will help you
isn't cron for things that should be run cronostically?
I believe so but it can also be set to run a script at boot. like I said I don't know how to use it but reading up might get you more info
compare against the hash on the above link
I know, it only has old hashes.
when I boot it from a USB it gives me the error: ubnentry1: file not found
I have verified that the md5sum is correct.
not sure how to help you sorry.
someone else might know. state your issue again.
